Sections.Name: Domains
Sections.Description: Please click on any topic to learn about resources that can help you manage that part of your life.

Parameters.Text: Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

FEAP WorkLife Program

UVA FEAP works to support faculty, staff and team members in navigating the competing demands of their work, personal, and family lives.

https://uvafeap.com/

Job Seeker Resources

Navigate specialized modules including how to update and refine your resume, analyze a job description, and use LinkedIn to network and research employers. (Note: This is a Collab site).

https://hr.virginia.edu/career-tools



Application and Interview Tips

Review best practices and learn to avoid common missteps.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sLffu1MWzqU



UVA HR Education and Training Programs

The UVA HR Education and Training Programs provide resources to support your growth and development so that you can do your best work at UVA. Several programs, team workshops, workday training, and other career tools are available through this resource to develop leadership and critical thinking skills.

https://hr.virginia.edu/career-development/education-and-training-0



Career Tools

Contains job seeker resources and videos containing strategies for success that cover topics such as starting points, networking, job searching, applying, and more.

https://hr.virginia.edu/career-tools

The Mediation Process Through FEAP

Mediation is a method of third-party intervention in which impartial mediators help parties in conflict identify needs, interests and workable solutions.

https://uvafeap.com/organizational-services/mediation-services



FEAP Management and Supervisor Services

The Faculty and Employee Assistance Program provides management and organizational consultation on handling employee job performance issues and workplace concerns in accordance with company policy and procedure.

https://uvafeap.com/organizational-services/management-and-supervisor-services



University Ombuds

This is an independent, confidential resource that can assit staff in resolving problems, complaints, conflicts, and other issues.

https://eocr.virginia.edu/ombuds



UVA HR Career Development

UVA HR provides staff with various resources to develop their careers and enhace their experience in the workplace.

https://hr.virginia.edu/career-development
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

UVA Child Development Center

Open to families of employees and students, an. early childhood education center that acts as a high-quality family care solution.

https://www.kindercare.com/lp/private-center



UVA Family Stress Clinic

The Family Stress Clinic provides counseling services for individuals, couples or families experiencing a variety of difficulties and concerns in their lives.

https://uvahealth.com/locations/profile/family-stress-clinic



Healthy Families of Charlottesville/Albemarle

Healthy Families fosters nurturing family relationships for pregnant moms and safe environments for young children through regular home visiting.

https://readykidscville.org/family-support/healthy-families/



REAL Dads

REAL Dads coaches incarcerated fathers and fathers who want a stronger relationship with their children to have Responsible, Empowered, Available and Loving relationships with their families.

https://readykidscville.org/family-support/real-dads/



Region Ten Child and Family Services

The Child and Family Services center provides prevention, substance use and mental health services to the children and families in our community. The goals of these services are to help families build resiliency and keep children/youth safely in their homes and communities when possible.

https://regionten.org/service-type/children-family/



FEAP Parenting Consultations

FEAP provides confidential, face to face consultations for caregivers who are seeking to grow in their role as parents or step-parents. Educational seminars on topics specific to parenting children and teens are also provided upon request. Services are designed to provide information, education, and support, as well as specific tools for navigating the day to day of the ever-changing process that is raising children.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/parenting



UVA Programs and Activities for Kids

Looking for fun things to do with your kid(s)? Check out this resource for activities to do with children at UVA!

https://www.law.virginia.edu/charlottesville/family/activities



Charlottesville Preschools and Daycare

UVA offers two childcare services for students, faculty, and staff and there are over 40 preschool and daycare options in the greater Charlottesville area.

https://www.law.virginia.edu/charlottesville/family/preschools-and-daycare



FEAP Resources for Childchare

FEAP offers a plethora of resources for childcare and day care, child counseling services, and babysitting services.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/resources-children

FEAP Clothing Resources

FEAP offers resources for general clothing, maternity and baby clothing, and laundry services.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/clothing-resources



FEAP Housing and Utlility Resources

FEAP offers resources for renting, affordable housing, and utilities.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/housing-and-utility-resources



FEAP Food Resources

FEAP offers resources for food banks and public meal programs, delivered food resources, and state food assistance.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/food-resources



Groceries in Charlottesville

Looking for a place to go grocery shopping? Yelp offers a list of all of the grocery store options here in Charlottesville!

https://gradstudies.virginia.edu/uva-and-charlottesville-guide



myPlan App

A free app to help with safety decisions if you, or someone you care about, is experiencing abuse in their intimate relationship. It’s private, secure, personalized, & backed by research.

https://www.myplanapp.org/

FEAP Workplace Seminars

FEAP offers a variety of workplace seminars. Broad topic areas include: content for supervisors/managers, balancing work and life, caregiving/eldercare, communication and relationships, mindfulness/compassion, parenting and positive practices.

https://uvafeap.com/organizational-services/workplace-seminars



Grieving: TIPS for living in a time of loss

Advice for people struggling with the loss of a loved one.

https://womenscenter.virginia.edu/2021/03/grieving-tips-living-time-loss
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Financial Wellness: Shifting from How Much You Have to How You Use It

Learn about what financial wellness means and how to achieve it in your own life

https://www.eudaimonicbydesign.com/resilience/financial



Tools from UVA Community Credit Union

Interested in learning about managing your money, investing, or even buying a house? Attend a free, one-hour seminar through UVA Community Credit Union

https://www.uvacreditunion.org/content/Education-And-Tools

Financial Resources

This comprehensive list cultivated by the UVA Faculty and Employee Assistance Program (FEAP) can help you meet your financial needs.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/financial-resources



HoosWell Financial Resources

Having financial stress or just want to start focusing on your financial well-being? UVA offers a variety of financial resources from counseling to webinars which can help with all of your financial needs!

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/financial-wellness

FEAP Food Resources

Food assistance, delivered food resources.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/food-resources



FEAP Housing and Utilities Resources

Housing and utility resources available in the Charlottesville and Albemarle County area.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/housing-and-utility-resources



FEAP Transportation Resources

Bus and other transportation services.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/transportation-resources



FEAP Clothing Resources

Looking for discounted or affordable clothing? Check out this list of local clothing resources.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/clothing-resources
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Mindfulness Meditation Group

Each week there is a 30-minute guided meditation, followed by open discussion and questions.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/continue-your-practice/



Mindfulness Information Videos

Learn more about mindfulness from two of UVA’s Mindfulness Center Instructors.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/about/intro-to-mindfulness/



Mindfulness Recommended Reading

Readings, videos, and transcripts with information on mindfulness and how to incorporate it into your lifestyle.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/continue-your-practice/recommended-reading/



A Place to Breathe Meditation Studio

Offers classes in meditation, yoga, and other mindful practices for adults and children. In addition to their classes and workshops, they offer a private meditation room that is open during business hours for anyone to use free of charge.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/continue-your-practice/ongoing-meetings/



Compassionate Care Initiative

The UVA School of Nursing’s Compassionate Care Initiative (CCI) offers ongoing, weekly sessions on mindfulness meditation, mindful movement, yoga, and more. All drop-in sessions are free; no registration or previous experience required!

https://cci.nursing.virginia.edu/activities/calendar/



Tools of Transformation from eMindful

Interested in practicing mindfulness? Try eM Life, a free online mindfulness platform for UVA employees and spouses!

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/emotional-well-being/mindfulness-resources/emlife



UVA Mindfulness Center

Check out the Mindfulness Center for meditation and other stress-reduction online classes, events, recordings, and resources.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/programs/



UVA Contemplative Sciences Center

Check out the CSC for various yoga and mindfulness courses.

https://csc.virginia.edu/feature/contemplative-classes-yoga-mindfulness-and-more



UVA HR Mindfulness Resources

Both online and in person mindfulness courses that provide you with resources that are applicable and useful, support your emotional well-being, and help you thrive.

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/emotional-well-being/mindfulness-resources



Healthy Minds @Work program

Build mental skills that increase resilience and well-being in 5-7 minutes a day with an evidence-based program and mobile app built by neuroscientists. Open to all UVA employees.

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/emotional-well-being/healthy-minds-work

FEAP Self Care

A website with information on physical, spiritual, and emotional self care, as well as links to videos and resources.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/self-care



FEAP Stress Mangement

A website with informtion, resources, and organiztions to assist with stress management.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/stress-management



How to Stress More Effectively

Learn about how you can think about stress more positively

https://uvafeap.com/sites/feap/files/PDFs/Tip%20of%20the%20Month/FEAP%20Tip%20of%20the%20Month_April%2020_2021.pdf



Cultivating Optimism

Optimism is good for you -- and for those around you. Learn how to cultivate it!

https://uvafeap.com/sites/feap/files/PDFs/Tip%20of%20the%20Month/FEAP%20Tip%20of%20the%20Month_March%2016_2021_final.pdf



HoosWell Emotional Well-Being Programs

UVA has a variety of programs that offer you different outlets to cultivate emotional well-being, from free yoga classes to counseling!

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/emotional-wellness

The Sister Circle Program

Through the Women's Initiative, the Sister Circle program aims to address the needs of Black women living in Charlottesville.

https://thewomensinitiative.org/sister-circle/



Teladoc

If you need help, it's only a click away! Receive confidential, online therapy through Teladoc.

https://www.teladoc.com/aetna/



BIPOC Mental Health and Wellness Resources

Check out this comprehensive guide for BIPOC mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/1/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1529019313&single=true



LGBTQ+ Mental Health and Wellness Resources

Check out this comprehensive guide for LGBTQ+ mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1628978054&single=true



FEAP Positive Psychology

A FEAP counseling with a Positive Psychology Practitioner can provide you with information on the field of Positive Psychology and how you can learn to thrive more in your life.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/positive-psychology



FEAP Counseling Services

FEAP is available for individual consultation and short term, focused counseling for a variety of personal issues and common concerns.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services



FEAP Critical Incident Services

A critical incident is defined as any event that has the power to overwhelm usually effective coping mechanisms. Examples are the death of a coworker, suicide, traumatic workplace incident, severe or cumulative workplace stress or workplace or community disaster.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/critical-incidents



HELP Line

Check out this free and confidential telephone hotline serving Albemarle County where volunteers can provide judgement-free listening and help refer you to long-term services.

http://www.helplineuva.com/



Partner for Mental Health

Looking for mental illness support, referrals, or educational opportunities? Check out this resource that stands up for the rights and dignity of those with mental illness as they engage in treatment or in the justice system, while supporting creative solutions to interpersonal and legal challenges caused by mental illness.

https://partnerformentalhealth.org/



The Counseling Alliance of Virginia (CAVA)

Check out CAVA for counseling needs regarding the impact of mental illness, substance abuse, trauma, and/or other life stressors. CAVA offers a variety of clinical specialists who practice several different approaches to treatment.

https://www.cavahelps.com/



Region Ten

Looking for mental health support? Region Ten offers several services for mental health, including case management, intellectual disability, substance use, rehabilitation, and counseling.

https://regionten.org/services/



FEAP Resources in Support of Social Justice

Check out these virtual resources regarding education, action, reflection, and self-care to help acknowledge the pain of injustices suffered, offer support to those hurting or distressed, and offfer resources for those who want to learn and respond to foster social justice.

https://uvafeap.com/services/virtual-resources-library/resources-support-social-justice



FEAP Virtual Resources for Stress Management

Check out these resources to help support your mental and emotional wellness.

https://uvafeap.com/services/virtual-resources-library/virtual-resources-support-stress-management



Central Virginia Clinicans of Color Network (CVCCN)

CVCCN is a supportive network that empowers clinicians of color and builds capacity for providing culturally responsive mental health treatment.

https://cvccn.org/



HoosWell Portal and Rewards

It's already important to focus on your well-being, but did you know that you can be rewarded for it, too? By participating in HoosWell, you can meet new people, feel healthier, and even win monetary rewards!

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/earn-rewards



Live health coaching with Virgin Pulse

Take advantage of unlimited access to certified Health Coaches through one-on-one conversations to establish personalized well-being goals. Open to employees (and spouses) enrolled in the UVA Health Plan or UPG Anthem Health Plan.

https://app.member.virginpulse.com/#/live-services-coaching/topics
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Phone-based tobacco cessation coaching

In the Hoos Well Portal, participants in the UVA Health Plan or UPG Anthem Health Plan can partner with an experienced tobacco cessation specialist to develop an individualized quit plan, co-create attainable goals, resolve ambivalence, overcome cravings, explore triggers, discover motivators for lasting change, and discuss whether nicotine replacement therapy and cessation-supportive medications are right for you.

https://app.member.virginpulse.com/#/live-services-coaching/landing-page?topicInternalName=TobaccoFree



Tobacco cessation Journeys in the Hoos Well portal

UVA employees and spouses on the UVA Health Plan and UPG Anthem Health Plan can earn rewards for participating in Journeys (online, self-directed learning modules) in the Hoos Well portal. Topics include “Ready, Set, Stop Smoking,” “Consider Quitting,” and “Stay on Track, Stay Quit.”

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/physical-well-being/tobacco-cessation-resources



FEAP Counseling: Alcohol and Other Drugs

FEAP offers counseling options for a number of substance abuse related issues that are designed to make your path towards health easier and more supported.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/alcohol-and-other-drugs

UVA Walking Trails

There are a lot of places to walk around Grounds. This map will help you explore all of them!

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/physical-well-being/uva-walking-paths



Free Group Exercise and Fitness Classes

IM-Rec Sports is a proud partner with Hoos Well to help you be stronger today than you were yesterday. The gyms are open and safe, there is instructor led fitness outside, in the gym and at home. Is today the right day to start a health journey? Explore virtual and in-person drop-in classes and enrollment-based instructional programs. All Hoos Well sponsored drop-in classes and instructional programs are free for employees. Spouses enrolled in the UVA Health Plan or UPG Anthem Health Plan may also participate.

https://recsports.virginia.edu/hoos-well



FEAP Healthcare Resources

Check out this comprehensive list of local resources for various healthcare needs, including free medical and dental clinics, family planning, and prescription assistance.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/healthcare-resources



HoosWell Physical Well-Being Programs

Looking to develop a passion for a healthy lifestyle? HoosWell Physical Well-being Programs provide all types of tools to improve your physical well-being.

https://hr.virginia.edu/physical-wellness



HoosWell Portal and Rewards

It's already important to focus on your well-being, but did you know that you can be rewarded for it, too? By participating in HoosWell, you can meet new people, feel healthier, and even win monetary rewards!

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/earn-rewards



FEAP Aging Resources

Resources for aging needs including temporary in-home care.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/aging-resources



Live health coaching with Virgin Pulse

Take advantage of unlimited access to certified Health Coaches through one-on-one conversations to establish personalized well-being goals. Open to employees (and spouses) enrolled in the UVA Health Plan or UPG Anthem Health Plan.

https://app.member.virginpulse.com/#/live-services-coaching/topics

One-on-One Virtual Nutrition Counseling Consultation:

Employees & Spouses covered on the UVA Health Plan or UPG Anthem Health Plan receive one free, 60-minute virtual consultation with a Registered Dietitian each year! Follow up visits may be covered by your insurance and can be scheduled after the initial consultation. Visits will be conducted virtually until further notice.

https://uvahealth.com/services/nutrition



Virtual Prenatal Nutrition Counseling:

Meet with a Registered Dietitian for individualized guidance on how to nourish yourself during and after pregnancy. Two free visits are included for all employees and spouses covered by the UVA Health Plan or UPG Anthem Health Plan.

https://uvahealth.com/services/nutrition/classes

Planned Parenthood

Check out Planned Parenthood for both informational resources on STDs, pregnancy, birth control options, and more, or to schedule an in-person or telehealth appointment with a medical professional.

https://www.plannedparenthood.org/



Planned Parenthood: Pregnancy Information

Check out this resource on prenatal care, fertility treatments, pregnancy options, postpartum depression, and more!

https://www.plannedparenthood.org/learn/pregnancy



Thrive Central Virginia

Check out this center for both its 24/7 helpline and both walk-in or scheduled appointments regarding pregnancy testing, confidential options counseling, abortion information, ultrasounds, pregnancy support, post-abortion care and support, and more!

https://thrivecentralva.org/
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Sexual Assault Resource Agency

The Sexual Assault Resource Agency (SARA) provides free, confidential support services for survivors of all genders.

https://saracville.org



Shelter for Help in Emergency (SHE)

The Shelter for Help in Emergency (SHE) offers trauma-based resources for survivors of domestic violence and aims at creating a community of empowerment and support.

https://www.shelterforhelpinemergency.org

Couples Counseling through FEAP

Looking to strengthen your relationship? FEAP offers a variety of resources for couples, such as consultations, educational seminars, and a short-term, skill-building program.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/couples



National Healthy Marriage Resource Center

The Natioanl Healthy Marriage Resource Center offers a variety of resources to help married couples develop a healthier relationship.

http://www.healthymarriageinfo.org



The Gottman Institute

The Gottman Institute is focused on improving the well-being of marriages, families, and relationships through a research-based approach.

https://www.gottman.com/about/



Live health coaching with Virgin Pulse

Take advantage of unlimited access to certified Health Coaches through one-on-one conversations to establish personalized well-being goals. Open to employees (and spouses) enrolled in the UVA Health Plan or UPG Anthem Health Plan.

https://app.member.virginpulse.com/#/live-services-coaching/topics
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

UVA Black Faculty and Staff Employee Resource Group

The UVA Black Faculty and Staff Employee Resource Group seeks to provide mentorship, recruitment, professional development, collegiality, and retention opportunities for Black faculty and staff.

https://www.uvabfserg.org



Virginia Festival of the Book

Do you like to read and write? Are you looking to connect with other readers and writers? The Virginia Festival of the Book strives to connect readers and writers across Virginia to celebrate books, reading, literacy, and literacy culture.

https://www.vabook.org/about/



UVA IM-Rec Sports Free Staff Fitness

Looking to exercise and meet a new group of people? UVA faculty, staff, and their spouses are eligible to participate in a free weekly exercise class.

https://www.go.recsports.virginia.edu/Program/GetProgramDetails?courseId=e4530a9c-1452-4063-b46e-b02747baf268&semesterId=a5cc2f04-3703-45b7-89ab-0a16497e38ed



UVA International Center

Looking to engage with different cultures across the University? The UVA International Center is for you!

https://internationalcenter.virginia.edu

UVA FEAP Events

FEAP offers opportunities to connect with other UVA employees through events, currently over Zoom.

https://uvafeap.com/events



UVA Employee Volunteer Resource Hub

Volunteering can offer a great opportunity to connect with other people across your community. The UVA Employee Volunteer Resource Hub provides a variety of volunteering opportunities within Charlottesville and beyond.

https://hr.virginia.edu/time/volunteer-center

Mobile Safety App

A mobile app with resources for safety that includes a "SafeWalk" feature.

https://safetyandsecurity.virginia.edu/mobile-safety-app
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Womens Initiative -- Sister Circle

Sister Circle offers a social support group to meet the needs of people from across the African diaspora who identify as women in various ways: one of which being, recognizing the unique mental health challenges and trauma created by anti-Black racism and systemic oppression of BIPOC individuals.

https://thewomensinitiative.org/sister-circle



UVA Black Faculty and Staff Employee Resource Group

The UVA Black Faculty and Staff Employee Resource Group seeks to provide mentorship, recruitment, professional development, collegiality, and retention opportunities for Black faculty and staff.

https://www.uvabfserg.org



PFLAG

"First and largest" organization for connected to the LGTBQ+ community with over 400 chapters, including one in Charlottesvile

https://pflag.org/



The Activists' Guide

The Activists' Guide is a Charlottesville based organization that hat connects activists across the community and provides with resources such as activists' techniques and a newsletter, and more!

https://www.law.virginia.edu/public-service/community-and-activism



Jefferson School African American Heritage Center

Located in the Jefferson School City Center near the Downtown Mall, the African American Heritage Center works to honor and preserve the history of African Americans in Charlottesville. They host events, exhibitions, education opportunities, and so much more.

https://jeffschoolheritagecenter.org

BIPOC Mental Health and Wellness Resources from the UVA Women's Center

Check out this comprehensive guide for BIPOC mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center at UVA.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/1/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1529019313&single=true



LGBTQ+ Mental Health and Wellness Resources from the UVA Women's Center

Check out this comprehensive guide for LGBTQ+ mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center at UVA.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1628978054&single=true



Sister Circle's 10 Self-Care Tips for Black Women

Looking to engage in some self-care? Here's 10 ways you can!

https://static1.squarespace.com/static/50a50853e4b013b04b89ffc5/t/5ed80f43b6b8fc226c25e275/1591218015612/2020-06+Sister+Circle+Self-Care+Tips.pdf



Wellness Tools from the Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective

Explore different ways that you can care for your emotional and mental health with these resources compiled by the Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective.

https://www.beam.community/tool-kits-education

Talking About Race

Conversations about race are important -- here's a guide from the National Museum of African-American History and Culture that can help you navigate them.

https://nmaahc.si.edu/learn/talking-about-race



The Guide to Allyship

Interetsed in learning what it takes to be an effective ally? Here's a guide.

https://guidetoallyship.com/?fbclid=IwAR1TfKMWgVCGshdjbJaT7z5ZgVPGa76i0mzOmSVmzOgEdosOJ0j4UPFKOcQ



How Organizations Can Support the Mental Health of Black Employees

Here's a Harvard Business Review article on how you can support the mental health of your colleagues that identify as Black.

https://hbr.org/2020/06/how-organizations-can-support-the-mental-health-of-black-employees



Workplace Mental Health for Asian American Professionals

Learn about the unique challenges that people who identify as Asian American face in the workplace and what employers can do to provide support.

https://www.mindsharepartners.org/post/workplace-mental-health-for-asian-american-professionals-featuring-insights-from-employees-at-adobe



Supporting Asian American Individuals

Here's a CNBC article on some ways you can support individuals that identify as Asian American, particularly in the wake of anti-Asian violence during the COVID-19 pandemic.

https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/19/how-to-support-asian-american-colleagues-amid-anti-asian-violence.html



UNC Project READY: Allies and Antiracism

Project Ready is a free online professional development curriculum provides information about how to be an ally and engage in anti-racist work.

https://ready.web.unc.edu/section-1-foundations/module-13-allies-antiracism/



Allyship and Activism Resources for the Black Community

This Google doc provides tips and strategies to engage in efffective anti-racist activism as well as educational resources such as books, movies, and podcasts.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Oh6BuEqhU9y1Zrpp4Z8vVQNDYYjSB_MJTNu18PaAGls/mobilebasic



LGBTQIA Allyship Tips from UC Davs

This site provides general resources tied to providing allyship to trans, intersex and asexual communities.

https://lgbtqia.ucdavis.edu/educated/ally-tips

The Charlottesville Activists' Guide

Looking for fun this weekend? Charlottesville based organization that connects activists across the community and provides activisits with resources

https://activistsguide.org



Black Lives Matter

A global network of activists whose mission is to eradicate white supremacy and empower Black communities

https://blacklivesmatter.com/about/



Human Rights Campaign

Group striving to create equality for the LGBTQ+ community, specifically those who are trans, people of color, and HIV+, in the U.S. and the world as a whole

https://www.hrc.org/



PFLAG

"First and largest" organization for connected to the LGTBQ+ community with over 400 chapters, including one in Charlottesvile

https://pflag.org/



NCAAP

One of the oldest activism groups, NCAAP hopes to achieve equality, both socially and politically, through eradication of discrimination while securing the academic and economic well-being of black people

https://naacp.org/



5 Calls

Want to demand change from your representatives but not sure where to start? 5 Calls can help demystify the process! Just enter your location, choose issues that are important to you, and the website will tell you who to call and what to say.

https://5calls.org/



UVA Voices of Equity

Voices of Equity is an interactive library that contains 50 years of documents addressing racial inequity at UVA. You can explore their interactive timeline, examine trends through their analyses, and even request that additional documents be added to the website. Join the conversation today.

https://voicesforequity.virginiaequitycenter.org



Jefferson School African American Heritage Center

Located in the Jefferson School City Center near the Downtown Mall , the African American Heritage Center works to honor and preserve the history of African Americans in Charlottesville. They host events, exhibitions, education opportunities, and so much more.

https://jeffschoolheritagecenter.org



The Equity Center

The UVA Democracy Initiative Center for the Redress of Inequity through Community Engaged Scholarship (aka The Equity Center) represents a new model of community engaged scholarship, imagining the university as not just an anchor institution, but also an authentic community resource. Our community partnerships and advocacy within the University work in tandem to create a more equitable culture.

https://virginiaequitycenter.org/

https://eocr.virginia.edu/

https://eocr.virginia.edu/

UVA Voices of Equity

Voices of Equity is an interactive library that contains 50 years of documents addressing racial inequity at UVA. You can explore their interactive timeline, examine trends through their analyses, and even request that additional documents be added to the website. Join the conversation today.

https://voicesforequity.virginiaequitycenter.org



Jefferson School African American Heritage Center

Located in the Jefferson School City Center near the Downtown Mall , the African American Heritage Center works to honor and preserve the history of African Americans in Charlottesville. They host events, exhibitions, education opportunities, and so much more.

https://jeffschoolheritagecenter.org



The Equity Center

The UVA Democracy Initiative Center for the Redress of Inequity through Community Engaged Scholarship (aka The Equity Center) represents a new model of community engaged scholarship, imagining the university as not just an anchor institution, but also an authentic community resource. Our community partnerships and advocacy within the University work in tandem to create a more equitable culture.

https://virginiaequitycenter.org/

University Ombuds

Ombuds is an independent, confidential resource that can assist faculty in resolving problems, complaints, conflicts, and other issues.

https://eocr.virginia.edu/ombuds



Title IX and Sexual Misconduct

Use this tool to initiate a Title IX or sexual misconduct complaint and/or learn more about the process of filing and the resources that are available to you.

https://eocr.virginia.edu/resources-employees



Just Report It

Faculty, students, staff, and employees may report an incident of bias/discrimination/harassment, hazing, sexual assault, sexual exploitation, intimate partner violence, stalking, sexual or gender-based harassment, complicity, or retaliation using Just Report It, the University's online incident reporting system.

https://justreportit.virginia.edu/



Reporting Discrimination and Harassment

Use this tool to learn more about the process of filing a discrmiination or harassment complaint and/or initiate the process of filing a complaint.

https://eocr.virginia.edu/discrimination-and-harassment



Office for Equal Opportunity and Civil Rights

The UVA Office for Equal Opportunity and Civil Rights (EOCR) works to ensure equal opportunity and protect the civil rights of all University community members. Through EOCR, you can learn more about the process of reporting instances of mistreatment, discrimination, or harassment and initiate the process of reporting if you choose to do so.

https://eocr.virginia.edu/
